forms.title: IQ Test
forms.description: General iq testing that tests your skills in numerical and logical reasoning.

questions.question: Which number completes the series: 3, 5, 8, 12, 17, ?
A dozen equals 12 units.
What number is missing from the pattern: 1, 4, 9, __, 25?
Which word is the odd one out?
Which direction would you face if you turn 90 degrees clockwise from North?
Find the missing letter in the sequence: A, C, E, G, ?
If all cats are animals, and some animals are black, then some cats must be black.
What is the next fraction in the sequence: 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, ___?
Which shape is different: Square, Circle, Triangle, Rectangle?
Which word is most similar to 'Profound'?
If you have 5 fingers, you have 2 hands.
What is 15% of 200?
If 'FEW' is coded as '26', how is 'TEN' coded? (A=1, B=2...)
What is the value of $(2 + 3) 	imes 4$?
A cube has 8 faces.
What is the capital of France?
Which animal is the odd one out: Dog, Cat, Lion, Eagle?
Choose the correct analogy: Foot is to shoe as Hand is to ___.
A person traveling 60 miles per hour will cover 60 miles in one hour.
If yesterday was Tuesday, what is the day after tomorrow?
What is the next number in the sequence: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, ?
If all roses are flowers, and all flowers fade quickly, then all roses fade quickly.
The sum of all angles in a triangle is 360 degrees.
What is the result of $10 - 2 	imes 3$?
Which number is prime: 9, 15, 17, 21?
Choose the word that fits: A flock of birds is to a school of fish as a pack of wolves is to a ___ of lions.
If you rearrange 'NAPLE', you get the name of a fruit. Which fruit?
Every four years has 366 days (leap year).
A is the father of B. B is the mother of C. What is A's relation to C?
Which letter is out of place: A, C, E, F, G, I?

forms.title: English Test and Logic Puzzles
forms.description: Tests verbal ability, grammar, and complex logical reasoning.

questions.question: Select the synonym for 'Mellifluous'.
Select the antonym for 'Lethargy'.
'She went to the store, and he went to the bank.' is a compound sentence.
Complete the analogy: Day is to Sun as Night is to ___?
Identify the subject in the sentence: 'Running every morning keeps me healthy.'
Which of these words is spelled correctly?
The word 'data' is always treated as singular in modern American English.
What is the collective noun for a group of crows?
Choose the correct preposition: 'He is accustomed ___ the noise.'
Which verb tense is 'had been running'?
Logical deduction: All dogs bark. Rover is a dog. Therefore:
The semicolon is used to separate items in a series that already contain commas.
What is the plural of 'criterion'?
Which word is the main noun in the sentence: 'The tall, dark, and handsome man smiled.'?
Which word is the odd one out?
What is the gerund in the sentence: 'Swimming is great exercise.'
Which sentence has a dangling modifier?
options: After turning the corner, the police officer saw the suspect.
To win the prize, hard work is required.
Having finished the report, she took a break.
questions.correctAnswer: To win the prize, hard work is required.

questions.question: 'Who' should be used when referring to the object of a verb or preposition.
Define the figure of speech 'oxymoron' with one word.
Choose the correct pronoun: 'Between you and ___'
Logic: All A are B. No C are A. Therefore:
Which of the following is a complete sentence?
The apostrophe in 'dogs' bowls' correctly indicates plural possession.
What is a four-line stanza called?
Identify the conjunction: 'He failed the test because he didn't study.'
Complete the sentence: 'Neither John ___ Mary were at the party.'
If a clock takes 5 seconds to strike 5 (4 intervals), how long will it take to strike 10 (9 intervals)?
In formal writing, it is acceptable to end a sentence with a preposition.
What is the past participle of the irregular verb 'swim'?
Which word is an adverb?

forms.title: Programming Problem Solving
forms.description: Tests fundamental knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and syntax.

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
Which is NOT an object-oriented programming language?
Python uses strict type declaration for variables.
What command is used in Git to save changes to the local repository?
What is the time complexity of searching in a sorted array using Binary Search?
Which HTTP method is typically used to retrieve data?
SQL stands for Structured Query Language.
What is a variable declared outside of a function called?
What is the primary purpose of a 'while' loop?
Which data structure uses the Last-In, First-Out (LIFO) principle?
What is the default port for HTTPS?
An 'interpreter' executes code line by line.
What does CSS stand for?
Which type of error is NOT typically detected by the compiler?
In Python, `2 + 2 == 5` evaluates to `False`.
What is the process of finding and fixing errors in code called?
Which key principle involves bundling data and methods that operate on the data?
Which database model organizes data into tables?
A primary key in a database must contain unique values.
What is the result of `7 % 3` (the modulo operator) in most programming languages?
Which language is often used for front-end web development to add interactivity?
What is a 'fork' in the context of Git?
Recursion involves a function calling itself.
What does API stand for?
Which is a valid variable name in most languages?
What is the process of breaking down a complex problem into smaller, manageable parts?
The `finally` block in exception handling will execute whether an exception occurs or not.
Which network addressing protocol maps IP addresses to physical MAC addresses?
Which database is document-based and often used for flexible data storage?
Which network layer is responsible for logical addressing (IP addresses)?
